name: Hyatt Regency Mainz

reviews.text: The Hyatt is a new, glass n'steel box with an old fort integrated into it. The fort is used as a bar and has a pleasant terrace.
reviews.title: A modern hotel with ancient fort attached

reviews.text: The rooms are modern and unusually light and open. The bed was huge and very comfortable.
reviews.title: Unusually great for a Hyatt
New, very stylish hotel
reviews.text: Bathroom was massive but had an odd arrangement for the shower (which was in a glassed off wetroom that also contained the bath) that made it hard to turn the shower on without getting wet (one has to adjust temperature first after all).

reviews.title: Great Hotel on The Rhine
reviews.text: We really liked the location (quiet and right on the Rhine) and the public areas.

reviews.title: Wonderful and worth it
reviews.text: There is more than ample amounts of parking under the Hotel.

reviews.title: Comfortable and nice river walk
reviews.text: We are family of four took two rooms for two nights. Very good in all respects. Enjoyed the resturants and the summer beer garden next to the river.

reviews.title: Excellent hotel for business travellers
reviews.text: Stayed here several times whil doing business in the area. Built to accommodate American business folks. Large, beautiful rooms, great restaurant, and the lobby is a great place to hang out and have a drink or cigar. This is my first choice for staying in the Mainz/Frankfort/Russelsheim area.

reviews.title: A very accomodating hotel
reviews.text: My husband stayed at the Hyatt in Mainz while working for 2 weeks in a neighboring town. I joined him for 2 nights before we headed out for our trip across Germany finishing in Italy. This hotel was top notch all the way! We had a room overlooking the rhine that was perfect to watch the numerous barges traverse the river each day. The room had a large king size bed with crisp white linens & bathrobes. The best part about the room was the shower. It was a huge walk in shower with a stone slate floor & matching tube. You could spend all day standing underneath the rain shower head that beat down on you and massaged your body. Then you get your warm towel off the towel warmer and are so relaxed. The breakfast buffet & restaurant served excellent food. And on the suite floor there is a room that serves cocktails each evening with appetizers & breakfast in the am as well. Mainz is not a BIG tourist attraction but there was excellent food to be eaten & shopping was great. I am glad we started our journey here.

reviews.title: Sharp Hotel but not Five Star
reviews.text: Just spent one night at this hotel after a great river cruise. I had a certificate for a one nights stay for 130.00 and figured based on the reviews it would be worth it stay at this hotel. Also the location was within walking distance to the city center.

reviews.title: Closest thing to an impeccable chain hotel
reviews.text: Check in went smoothly as we were early and a room wasn't ready but I was promised a room within 1 hour. Came back and the room was ready but it ended up being the last room at the end of hall and just to far for my elderly mother to walk back and forth. They switched rooms but unfortuantely this one was smaller and my biggest issue was a nasty looking stain on the carpet by the bed. It looked like a dog had left something behind. On my way out for lunch I told the receptionist about the stain and she said that they would have somone come up and clean it. It never happened and I ended up putting a washcloth over the stain so I wouldn't have to look at it. It was just kind of gross and for a 5 star hotel to me not acceptable.
Business oriented hotel with mediocre rooms, very expensive extras and simply average staff.
reviews.title: Business Only!

reviews.text: Hyatt has the highest quality rooms in Mainz. I've stayed there twice and got two different size double rooms; The larger room has a larger bathroom with a glass enclosed rainshower besides a bathtub, but even the smaller room/bathroom is better than the room at the Hilton. The staff makes good restaurant recommendations but actually the hotel restaurant serves very good & creative continental dishes (not traditional German). Food presentation is probably far better than any restaurant in Mainz.
reviews.title: Luxury Hotel with a Gourmet Restaurant

reviews.text: The only drawback is its southern location which is about a 15 minute walk from oldtown. On the plus side, the Mainz Sud S-bahn train station is only a 7 minute walk from the hotel. It is also a 5 minute walk from my favorite restaurant in Mainz called Heiligen-Geist (Holy Ghost) which is a continental restaurant built inside an old church. Fairly reasonable prices and extensive menu.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel/Good Location
hyatt mainz
reviews.text: We spent 10 wonderful nights at this lovely hotel. The locations along the Rhein is beautiful and it's even lovelier in the Spring. Our room was very clean, modern and had a large bathroom. We did not eat in the restaurant, but did order numerous times from room service. Based on our room service meals, which were very delicious, I would imagine the restaurant would also be very good. They have a friendly and accommodating staff, every request we had was met with a quick response.

reviews.title: Lovely!
reviews.text: last weekend we stayed at the hyatt hotel.

reviews.title: wonderful!
reviews.text: I stayed at the Hyatt in Mainz for a week in May of 2003 while travelling on business. The hotel is decorated beautifully in light colored wood and lighted entirely with decorative accent lighting throughout. The restaurant is gorgeous, with an open kitchen made of glass and stainless-steel and offering the ability to eat outdoors if desired, overlooking the Rhine River. The wine cellar and bar contained within historic Fort Malkoff are connected directly to the hotel, and can be accessed through the lobby. There are dozens of other restaurants within walking distance in the lovely, historic town of Mainz. Parking is easy in the underground garage, and the multilingual staff seems to go out of their way to assist including assistance with things such as power converters. I booked a "no-frills" room at a low corporate rate, and was upgraded (after requesting) to a water view at no charge. This hotel was a pleasure...I will definitely go back.

description: Hyatt Regency Mainz is an exclusive hotel set on the banks of the river Rhine offering 268 rooms and suites. Spacious and modern architecture combined with views of the rivers Rhine and Main reflect the uniqueness of this elegant business hotel. Hyatt Regency Mainz features the exquisit Bellpepper restaurant and Malakoff bar. The historical city centre is within walking distance and Frankfurt International Airport is only a 25 minute car ride away.
